concept.title: Java Heap Size Configuration
concept.shortdesc: You can define the Java heap size. By default, the Java heap size is 1024 MB.

conbody.p: Java configuration optionsheap sizeheap sizeconfiguringThe Java heap size determines the heap size allocated to and affects the amount of memory can use when it runs a pipeline. Running a pipeline can use up to 65% of the allocated heap size.

Define the heap size as part of the SDC_JAVA_OPTS environment variable in the environment configuration file. Increase or decrease the heap size as necessary, based on the resources available on the host machine.

Use the following Java options to define the Java heap size:
Xmx - Defines the maximum heap size.
Xms - Defines the minimum heap size.

p.note: To avoid constant recalculation of the allocated heap size, set the both properties to the same value. To define the unit of measure, use m for MB and g for GB.

conbody.p: For example, to double the heap size, you might change the following default settings:SDC_JAVA_OPTS="-Xmx1024m -Xms1024m -XX:PermSize=128m -XX:MaxPermSize=256m -server ${SDC_JAVA_OPTS}"
to increase the Xmx and Xms settings as follows:

With a heap size of 2048 MB, you can configure a pipeline to use up to 65% - that's 1331 MB of memory.In the pipeline properties, you can use the jvm:maxMemoryMB() function to help define the percentage of the heap size the pipeline uses.
